nodes.bodyText:
We sync only 15 GA, but only tftpboot-installation for SP2 can be installed easily.
But this will not work for uyuni.
Should we include a fix RPM in sumaform which can be used with uyuni and suma independent of the version?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -20,6 +20,20 @@ Feature: Cobbler and distribution autoinstallation
     Then I should see a "testprofile" text
     And I should see a "testdistro" text
 
+  Scenario: Create SUSE Distibution with installer updates
+    When I install package "tftpboot-installation-SLE-15-SP2-x86_64" on this "server"
+    And I follow the left menu "Systems > Autoinstallation > Distributions"
+    And I follow "Create Distribution"
+    When I enter "SLE-15-SP2-x86_64" as "label"

+    And I select "SLE-Product-SLES15-Pool for x86_64" from "channelid"

nodes.bodyText: Using now existing SLE11 fake media to create this distro. It cannot be used, but it let us test the feature.

nodes.bodyText:
The feature is a feature of SUSE manager.
Change to Installer update repositories please.

nodes.bodyText:
Same reason, remove "check".
When I add the product
I want the installer update channels to be synched
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+# Copyright (c) 2020 SUSE LLC
+# Licensed under the terms of the MIT license.
+
+Feature: Check Installer Update repositories
+  In order to use installer updates
+  As root user
+  I want to check that Installer-Updates Channels got synced when adding the product

nodes.bodyText:
I do not get this. The test just verify that the installer update repo got synced.
The product is not added here.
I could understand to move the test into the feature where also the sync happens, but here we really just check that
the repositories got enabled.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+# Copyright (c) 2020 SUSE LLC
+# Licensed under the terms of the MIT license.
+
+Feature: Check Installer Update repositories
+  In order to use installer updates
+  As root user
+  I want to check that Installer-Updates Channels got synced when adding the product

nodes.bodyText: It's only about labeling. A "cucumber feature" refers to a feature of the product (SUSE manager). It's not a "test feature". Just avoid the obvious "check", "verify", "test" and say what the product is supposed to do.

nodes.bodyText:
I wonder if that duplicates the functionality of:
Then(/^I should see a "([^"]*)" text in element "([^"]*)"$/) do |text, element|
  within(:xpath, "//div[@id=\"#{element}\" or @class=\"#{element}\"]") do
    raise "Text #{text} not found in #{element}" unless has_content?(text)
  end
end
